bibl.note: This is a very brief copy of a letter, dated June 10 ca. 1815, from Return J. Meigs, agent to the Cherokee Nation, to the Secretary of War informing him of the drawing of five-hundred dollars for the promotion of Indian civilization.

div.p: Authorized by your letter of the 15th May last to draw on you at sight for Five hundred Dollars, appropriated for the promotion of Indian civilization I have drawn for that sum in favor of Josiah Nichol this day.
div.closer:
I am Sir yr Your Obedient Servant
Return J. Meigs , agent for the Cherokees The Honble Honorable Secretary of War (Copy)
Letter to the Secretary of War June 10th
